title: Egyptian Fraction Representation
content: x = Σ_{n ∈ S} 1/n where S is a finite set of distinct positive integers from A. This ancient concept was used by Egyptians and formalized by Fibonacci.

title: Greedy Step
content: Given x > 0, find the smallest n ∈ A with 1/n ≤ x. Subtract 1/n and repeat. This greedy approach always picks the largest possible unit fraction.

title: Fibonacci's Theorem (1202)
content: The greedy algorithm terminates for all x ∈ (0,1] when A = ℕ \ {0}. This is the classical result establishing that every positive rational has an Egyptian fraction decomposition.

title: Odd Positive Integers
content: A = {1, 3, 5, 7, ...}. The problem restricts denominators to this set and asks about rationals with odd denominators in lowest terms.

title: Stein's Odd Greedy Conjecture
content: The greedy algorithm terminates for all x ∈ (0,1] with odd denominator when restricted to odd denominators. This is the main question of Problem #282.

title: Graham's Representability (1964)
content: Algebraic conditions determine when m/n can be written as a sum of distinct unit fractions with denominators ≡ a (mod d). This gives representability but says nothing about greedy termination.

title: Erdős–Graham Squares Conjecture
content: The greedy algorithm on A = {n² : n ≥ 1} 'perhaps fails to terminate almost always.' This contrasts with the odd-denominator case where termination is expected.
